title: Manchester United legends to take on Barcelona side in charity match at Nou Camp in June
text:
Manchester United legends to take on Barcelona side in charity match at Nou Camp in June The game was originally set for last year but was postponed due to Euro 2016 with a return at Old Trafford set for September Share Comments By Liam Prenderville 16:36, 28 FEB 2017 Sport Manchester United legends are set to play a double-header with Barca (Photo: Getty) Share Comments Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Manchester United legends are set to take on their Barcelona counterparts in an all-star encounter this summer.
The game was originally set for last year but was postponed due to Euro 2016.
But the two sides will finally meet for charity at the Nou Camp on June 30.
There is no confirmation yet who will be involved but the likes of Paul Scholes , Dwight Yorke and Denis Irwin are set to play a match for the United legends this month.
Hristo Stoichkov, Gaizka Mendieta and Ronald de Boer have all turned out for an all-star Barca side in the past.
Scholes and Yorke are set to play (Photo: Getty) Ronaldinho returned to Barcelona as ambassador (Photo: AFP/Getty) They could be joined by Brazilian legend Ronaldinho for the clash this summer.
The 36-year-old has returned to the club in an ambassadorial role and it was confirmed upon his appointment that he would be involved in the legends side.
All proceeds from the game will go to the FC Barcelona Foundation.
There will also be a return match between the two sides at Old Trafford on September 2.
